result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin J Geiger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact with Amanda W.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling or treatment programs as directed by his supervising agent. 
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample (applies to count #2). 
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall advise his supervising agent within 48 hours of being prescribed medications.
Defendant shall advise health care providers of his addiction history.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count #1 and any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: All same conditions as listed for probation.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Count #1 and any other sentence.

timeConds.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

Condition time is stayed and may be imposed at the probation agent's discretion.
